result.execSummary:
The defendant Micah X. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with prison sentence in file 2014CF000006.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-----------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No driving without a valid driver's license.
-----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide DNA sample unless previously provided. Pay DNA surcharge.
-----------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

superTimeConds.notes: Complete community service work as ordered in file 2014CF000006.

Defendant Micah X. Smith in court, in custody with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant asks for 2 week continuance but preserves his right to demand a speedy trial to the extent of that date. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Micah X. Smith in court, in custody with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 3:25 p.m. Appearances made. State calls Deputy Jason Hintz who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam DA Necci. State's Exhibit S-1 (previously marked) identified as copy of criminal complaint. State moves exhibit into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received. 
3:28 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Kurzynski
3:30 p.m. - Witness responds to Court's question.
No further questions. Witness excused. No further witnesses - evidence closed.
3:31 p.m. - Argument by Attorney Attorney Kurzynski asking for dismissal.
3:31 p.m. - Argument by DA Necci
3:32 p.m. - Court makes a finding that probable cause exists and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information - reading waived. Not guilty plea and trial reserved. Speedy trial demand made by defendant. 
Court goes off the record to set date before Judge Koss
